storyInfo: Parliament works to track down Millscar, while Vina understands that she must confront Allerdale, who has chosen another path.

attributes.text: ♪May the vast lands they keep owre kynge.
\n\n♪His people, and alle his well-wyllynge,
\n\n♪And give them grace wythoute endyng!
\n\n♪Then may we call and savely syng,
\n\n♪Victoria, yeve thankes for owre hom!

attributes.content: <p=1>Throne Room, Palace of Westhaleg</><p=2>October 8th, 1098, 9:45 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.options: You've been humming that song ever since we stepped into the throne room.;Do you like it?

attributes.content: 'Like' is too strong a word. It's just left an impression on me.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: My foster parents would hum it by my bedside whenever I couldn't sleep.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I thought it was a lullaby. It's only long after they've passed on that I realized whom I was to them, who was their 'kynge'.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: The song became a stranger from that day forth, but the tune has remained familiar. I would never forget it.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.options: Do you still remember him? The...

attributes.content: The King? I'm not familiar with him. As for the man who is my closest blood relative...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I won't lie, Doctor, I tried to piece together an image of my father in my memory.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: But when I saw him again with my own eyes, there was nothing familiar about him.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: He was a king, and I'm just a gangster from the streets. We have nothing in common, save for the name Victoria.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: There are more important things for me to think about.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: You heard the dukes talking. They're ready to abandon Londinium... my home, to whatever fate.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: This wasn't what I expected when Dr. Kal'tsit got you out of Chernobog and got me to plan a return to Victoria.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: But I've come too far to let it go.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.options: Responsibility is a curious thing.;I can't let go of the Rhodes Islanders, either.;We're the same.
The dukes know you can't let go of the people who need you. They're counting on it.

attributes.content: And we're counting on them being obsessed with maintaining their own power.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: As long as their pride still needs the name 'Victoria', the city will have time to recover.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: It's a deal where the outcome is predetermined, and both sides of the table know that.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: It's the people who have had my back through all this that keeps me going.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: We're home. The war is over. It's time to listen to their voices.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: What is it, Doctor?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.options: Perhaps the day will come when Rhodes Island doesn't approve of the choices you make.;Perhaps the day will come when you don't approve of the choices Rhodes Island makes.

attributes.content: ...I know.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Many of us find it hard to accept that you assisted Wiš'adel with the evacuation of the remaining Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: But this war can go on no longer. I... We've lost enough people.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: And we've heard Sarkaz warning, loud and clear.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: The ducal fleets held their positions during the retreat because they all got the news—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Massive Catastrophe clouds forming over the capitals of most of the Core countries almost simultaneously.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Talk about straightforward. They strolled back to Kazdel in broad daylight.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: You and Dr. Kal'tsit know what they could do with that piece of Originium.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.options: They won't abuse it, unless their back is to the wall.

attributes.content: For self-defense only? Maybe they think that way, for now.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: But there is no such thing as a guarantee when one is in possession of power far greater than one can control.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I've seen many gangs rise rapidly with the backing of the nobility, only to fall apart from the inside just as quickly.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.options: That's why Amiya is going back to Kazdel with them.;Amiya will keep the Originium under our oversight.

attributes.text: But you're not in a position to determine Sarkaz's destiny either. Both sides have been inflicted wounds that will not heal so easily.
The young Sarkaz regent has gotten his wish. The Sarkaz are once again united by concrete hatred, and obtained an Originium shard that belongs to them...
Hatred always ends the same way. Where will you be when that time comes?

attributes.content: A golden lion walks out from behind the darkened throne and crouches by its side.
Gawain. It is like he was always here, like the reliefs around him, bearing witness to the Empire's rise and fall, all in the blink of an eye.
And now, his dark eyes have witnessed you.
Teacher?!
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.options: ...;This is the first time you've shown yourself before me.

attributes.text: No need to fear. I am neither a monster nor an illusion.
I show myself now because I must.
Vina has chosen a path that she had not even considered, until now. She must grow, and you are in a position to help her.

attributes.options: Rhodes Island is already assisting her work in Londinium.

attributes.text: That is not what I mean. I have no intention to interfere in Victoria's destiny, whatever it may be.
But you have led her towards a confrontation with the destiny of Terra itself, on which hope is hard to come by.
I promised one who is long gone to walk with her until the very last, but now, even my own being is no longer a certainty—

attributes.options: We will try not to drag others into it.

attributes.text: I know Vina. When the day comes, she will stand with Rhodes Island, and you will need her. But where will you stand when that day comes?
There is no need to answer. She will witness on my behalf.
You are neither her follower, nor mentor, nor foe.
You already realize that the ties you share are one-of-a-kind.
Perhaps we can afford to wait for a chance at a fresh start. But Vina cannot.
I have taught you how to survive, Vina. But I cannot teach you how to become hope—
The one before you, however, can.

attributes.options: I know what I must do.

attributes.text: Then guide her, the one whom Vina trusts. You are the spark that lights her fire, the spring that drives her forward.
Listen to this one, Vina, when you find yourself in doubt.

attributes.content: <p=1>Speaker's Office</><p=2>December 10th, 1098, 7:32 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: What is this instrument, Vina?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: An engineering sample made by Rockrock. Says it keeps tired workers from growing drowsy. But how's that different from just taking a nap?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Does it work?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Vina yawns, rubs her eyes, and continues to peruse the documents before her.
No.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: What DOES wake you up, though, is responding to some forty petitions to eliminate the traitor, Millscar.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Have the citizens fighting over this outside calmed down?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Yes. Horn brought a bunch of city guard's newcomers straight out of training camp.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Thank goodness it didn't get out of hand.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: It helped that the soldiers had families and comrades on both sides. *sigh* I really don't know what the people who still support Millscar are thinking.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: No surprise. It was Parliament that went back on its word first. We did have trouble with our medicine supply, and her stuff gave people hope.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Only false hope, though.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: At first, I thought you sent the Defense Forces to...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Crack down? Using violence to suppress innocent countrymen is the most cowardly and lest effective method—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Why are you looking at me like that?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Just feeling dumb for worrying at all.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Don't tease me. I've got a long way to go before I'm used to this role. Thank goodness I have a lot help from people I can trust.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: My teacher, the Doctor, and you... and many others.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: She stretches, puts down Rockrock's sample, and lets out a long exhalation.
I would be stumbling in the dark without the intel from your informants and our Rhodes Island colleagues.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: But Millscar...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Selling dangerous drugs of unknown origin, offering predatory loans, threatening the lives of the citizenry... and colluding with the Sarkaz...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: All the evidence lies in my drawer, all of it corroborated. She cannot be allowed to run unchecked just because some few benefited from association with her.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Allerdale, she—
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: It's not just her, Delphine.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: No one wants to see this hard-earned peace broken again, after all we've been through.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Parliament promised safety to the people. I know what must be done.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Very well. An old friend has a lead on her that might interest you.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: By the way, I've given serious consideration to the Doctor's suggestion.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Once things have settled down for a bit, I'll return to Windermere and take back certain things that have always belonged to me.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: How long will you be?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I don't know. But the Doctor is right. I need what Mother left behind, if I am to help you... even if I was reluctant at the time of her death.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: It's for myself, too. Victoria, Windermere, Lynncardine... I must see for myself that which Mother cared so much about.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: It's the only way I can get closer to her.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Sir! Please allow me to still call you that... I-I didn't think you would come to me.
attributes.name: Injured Exemplar

attributes.content: Did my application go through?
attributes.name: Injured Exemplar

attributes.content: Walker, I've heard how Pitt and the others got you to leave the scene of the protest. I think—
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: So that's not what you're here for... Alright. Actually, I've been listening to the radio, sir.
attributes.name: Walker

attributes.content: I heard about the artillery handover to the newly reorganized Defense Forces under your command, and the newly-constructed training plate outside the city.
attributes.name: Walker

attributes.content: I went to see it myself. The facilities are superb. I can even imagine myself training there...
attributes.name: Walker

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Walker, but I can't approve your application to join the Defense Forces.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Sure, if I'm not up to standard, I'll redouble my—
attributes.name: Walker

attributes.content: You know your own health. Training and fighting will only make it worse.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: My condition is under control. I'm taking medicine. I haven't felt any pain from the rocks for a while! I'm getting better—
attributes.name: Walker

attributes.content: Millscar's medicine, right? We've analyzed it, and it's...
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Nothing more than a painkiller. I know.
attributes.name: Walker

attributes.content: But that's what we need. Parliament's medicine rations are running out, aren't they?
attributes.name: Walker

attributes.content: At least this makes me feel better, for a while, and lets me practice wielding a crossbow with one hand. I'll pass the Defense Forces tests, sir.
attributes.name: Walker

attributes.content: 'There will be hope as long as we make it back home, no matter how bloody goddamned hard life is.' That's what you told me during the defense of Chetleigh.
attributes.name: Walker

attributes.text: 'We are the Exemplars.'
\n'We make miracles.'
\nWhat about life after the miracle, then? Where do the Exemplars go?

Horn said the miracle of the previous Exemplars lived on in Gaul, in the textbooks of military schools. What about us? It was a question no one needed to think about before we truly returned to Londinium.
\nWhen the city broadcast announced that the city belonged to the Victorians again, the youngest girl in my group asked me,
\n'Where do we go from here?'
I said we go home; I'll go back to the Slobberknocker with Hannah, Vina and Dagda, and you get to go home too.
\nBut the girl told me...
\n'I don't have a home anymore. I only have you.'

attributes.content: Vina and the others are here. We ought to go down.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Vina? Speaker Vina? She's coming for me too? Because of the protest?
attributes.name: Walker

attributes.content: Did you come to keep an eye on me, sir?
attributes.name: Walker

attributes.content: She came to help you because she knew Vina was coming. Same for all of us.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: There is no warmth in Londinium's sunset.
The survivors do not remember if it has always been this way. Those who come after will not even question it.
Once, The Shard was the pride of this old nomadic city. Now, people pay careful attention not to step into its shadow.
They all remember the day that terror itself descended upon its pinnacle, beneath the burning red sky.
Two walk side-by-side through the sparse crowd, the setting sun drawing long shadows behind them.
Those they pass bow to them, then go back to the work at hand, humming—
♪Then may we call and savely syng,
♪Victoria, yeve thankes for owre hom!
The refurbishment of The Shard seems to be proceeding ahead of schedule.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Rhodes Island helped a lot: providing medicine, taking in patients, and the Engineering Department has been helping with construction work in the city.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The initial incident left such an impression on the people that the proposal to modify The Shard met no significant opposition.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: And we're cleaning up the Originium crystal growths in the city while we're at it.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: But the engineers of the Self-Salvation Corps say it'll take some time for things to go back to normal. Even the mobility layer is affected.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Have we confirmed the retrieval team for The Shard's core technologies?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: We have a preliminary list, but we're still doing background checks on some of the technicians and scholars. They have... certain links, if you know what I mean.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I do. The dukes have given me a heads-up. We'll turn a blind eye, as long as there's no serious issue.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I, for one, am hoping that they find something worthwhile in that scrapheap. It would be a good thing for Victoria.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: And it's not such a bad thing for us if they started fighting over it.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Vina. Delphine.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Horn? I thought you were...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I came to visit an old comrade.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Don't mind me. I was just about to go and see how Bagpipe's doing with the new recruits.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Horn stretches, but shows no sign of leaving. Vina sighs.
Vina! You would never guess what Walker and I talked about. You remember the Davises, who came with us from Chetleigh? Well, the wife just gave birth—
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I know why you're here, Morgan.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Walker and the protests are a matter for Parliament... it's not something I should get involved in.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I'm just here to talk about the whereabouts of Millscar.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Thanks, but there's no need to make things difficult for Madam Speaker.
attributes.name: Walker

attributes.content: I trust Parliament. I know many MPs. Fine people.
attributes.name: Walker

attributes.content: Parliament is not as simple as you think. There are those who would prefer to escalate the issue.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: But resolving the Millscar issue as soon as possible is in the best interests of everyone, including you.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.text: The solder who charged into the city with us stood in the setting sun, suffering our 'interrogation'.
\nWe all know that Vina can influence Parliament... if she chooses to.
\nThat was the day when I truly realized that Vina had not belonged solely to the Glasgow Gang for a long time.
Maybe my Vina already said goodbye to us that afternoon.
\nThat day, all factories of the city came rumbling to life, and steam gushed up to the sky.
\nI saw her golden hair flying wild in the wind, blocking the fleeting tears in her eyes. She turned towards us with a smile and said—
'We're home.'
We're home. But things have not gone the way we expected.
\nDoes going back home mean goodbye?
\nWill we lose Vina?
'The factories welcome us!'
'There are survivors in the city!'
'Why do you stand in our way?'
'I'm sorry... dukes' orders. The Exemplars must not act on their own until the dukes have come to a conclusion.'
'Why are you pointing your bow at me?'
'Weren't we fighting side-by-side just a moment ago?'
'What do we do? Is that a... protest? In the city?'

attributes.content: <p=1>Londinium</><p=2>September 28th, 1098, 5:27 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: The city was angry.
The troops that stood in our way... are they falling back?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: The factories are waking up? I thought the Sarkaz had shut everything down.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: ...I remember these factories. I know where they are. I always will.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: That's Miles Industries on York Street! And that's Coppola Foods on Scott Street! And that's—
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: 'Consolidated Inc.'... 'Hankin's'... 'South Wicker Cargo'...
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: (Choked) Vina... I thought they...
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Those that were silent, those that had been abandoned, those that had been commandeered by the Sarkaz, and those that continued to run timidly.
All the city's factories came alive at the same time, but the Sarkaz hastily pulling back from the battlefield outside the city had no time to notice.
The steam that gushed out was the breath of steel and machine. The factories were roaring.
What's going on?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: They're helping us. Londinium is helping us.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: March on, Exemplars. It's time to bring this to an end.
attributes.name: Allied Soldier

attributes.content: This is Lieutenant Diane Weber of the Sixth Column, Tenth Infantry Regiment. Lower your weapons, soldiers, and escort the Exemplars in their advance.
attributes.name: Allied Soldier

attributes.content: You're defying the dukes?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Before I was a soldier, I was a Londinier. This is my home too.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: Go, Siege. The fight is not yet over.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: We will take back what is ours!
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: The first squad starts lowering their crossbows, and they are soon followed by others, who step aside to clear a path.
Exemplars, forward!
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: We're home.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Keep the factories running at full steam! Keep the Sarkaz at bay just a bit longer!
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: The dukes want people to think there's no Victorians left alive, justifying them sitting on their hands out there. But we'll make 'em hear we're still here!
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: The people outside the walls will know we haven't given up yet!
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Thanks for the assist, Madam Catherine. You can trust our guys; everyone has a trick or two up their sleeves.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Nine and the others are working on the other factories. This whole city is about to rise up.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Are you coming back... Feist?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Is it on?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: On it is! The other factories have also been restored, just as the Doctor planned.
attributes.name: Guard Operator

attributes.content: It's not just the citizens that are helping us though. There are other people, and they call themselves—
attributes.name: Guard Operator

attributes.content: Reunion...
attributes.name: Guard Operator

attributes.content: Well, well. I haven't seen the city so lively in years.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: I just got word that alliance troops have cleared a path for the Exemplars.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: That wasn't our orders. Are you happy with the test results?
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: It seems we have underestimated the influence of a miracle.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: We should hasten our preparations, then.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Hey, boss, looks like we don't have to cause a commotion anymore.
attributes.name: Mysterious Mercenary

attributes.content: They're letting the Exemplars through.
attributes.name: Mysterious Mercenary

attributes.content: Pull the ambush and give a hand to the factories we captured.
Tell the people in charge that the boilers keep burning until I say stop.
You got it.
attributes.name: Mysterious Mercenary

attributes.content: Welcome home, Vina.
<p=1>Speaker's Office</><p=2>December 10th, 1098, 9:28 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Speaker's Office.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Walker's fine. Parliament won't come down hard on him over this little thing. But tell him to stay safe.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: There's no telling if the people watching us might find him inconvenient to them.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: And... how are things going over there?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: ...Good.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: We'll find you...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Allerdale.
attributes.name: Vina
